text:
It pours a deep murky brown body with a creamy beige head that last. Nice lacing. 

Aroma is rather mild. Some yeast and some spice. But very light. Malts. 

Taste is grainy, slightly peppery, yeast, roasty dark malts. Dry finish. 

Light but oily mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. 

Its like a mix of lager and a belgian ale.

Pours dark brown with ruby shades and a tan head. Aroma is fruity with plums, dates, figs, chestnut, earthy hops. Taste follows, lots of caramel, super malty. Soft to medium carbonation, medium body and very sticky mouthfeel.

Bold caramel malty aroma is barely held in check by mild peppery hops. Malt bomb territory. Thick syrupy mouthfeel. Its a caramelly malt bomb, and quite one-dimensional, but very tasty. Pours a murky brown with a slight tan head.

Flöska. Clar dark brown colour, nice medium beige head, ok lasting. sweet well toasted malty caramel dark fruity aroma . Sweet well toasted caramel and malty flavour with some dark fruits, bit alcohol to it, medium bitterness.

Given their relative rarity in Nebraska, Im still fairly new to La Trappes offerings, but everything Ive tried from them has been incredibly smooth. La Trappes Bockbier is beyond drinkable, and thats worth noting - bock is the German word for strong, after all. This brew pours dark brown with a cream-colored head. Rich and somewhat fruity aromatics. Toast, molasses, fig, plum, and apricot. Flavor profile showcases brown sugar, caramel, toffee, and subtle chocolate and succulent fruit. Theres some touches of warmth and syrupy starch but nothing that makes you take a pause. The rich flavors indicate this is a sipper, but the smoothness tells your palate something else. I polished this off in no time flat.
Off white head, some lacing. Dark brown colour. Medium carbonation. Toffee like flavours.

Dark brown, ruby color with a thin but persistent tan head. Nice lacing. Aroma is caramel malts, dried prunes, toffee and some alcohol. Taste is miderately bittersweet and largely follows the nose. Light to medium body, average to low carbonation.

Fles. Tijdje terug dat ik iets van La Trappe dronk, maar het restaurant vanavond had weinig keuze buiten wat geijkte speciaalbieren en veel van La Trappe. Dus deze maar weer eens. Bokbier met stoutachtige smaak, niet fel van smaak overigens. Gewoon goed, maar geen uitschieter. Mooi donker.

Appearance - dark, reddish brown with a pretty white head.

Aroma & Taste - nutty, caramel. Not too sweet, though, not like those caramel fudge bars, but actual homemade caramel that just has that perfect balance of the nutty brown buttery notes and juust the right amount of toasted sugar. It does have a solid bitterness in both taste and after-taste, but to me that is absolutely perfect when the majority of bockbier is just *so* sweet. It gives it a very direct character. 

Palate - medium body, good carbonation. Nothing to complain about.

Overall - my favorite Bock to date. If like me you like your bocks (or beers in general) to be less on the sweet side and more on the bitter side, this ones for you.

0,33 l bottle. Pours brown with red hue and big thick lasting tan head. Aroma is rich with malt, some yeast and also some alcohol, toffee and caramel, but also some citruses and dried fruit. Figs and plums. Taste is light sweet with moderate bitterness. Body is surprisingly light with slick texture, average to lively carbonation and long bitter finish.

Cola brown foamy tan head. Sweet creamy aroma. Sugary, black liqourice, chestnut taste. Medicinal bitter finish. Alright but nothing special. What makes this a dunkler bock? Seems like a dubbel to me and in that case La Trappes Dubbel was much more satisfying.

Piwo o barwie rubinowej z piękną, utrzymującą się pianą. Aromat średnio intensywny ale różnorodny, karmel, owoce, skórka od chleba. W smaku owoce ciemne, bardzo fajny wytrawny finisz pasujący do tego piwa. Bardzo pijalne i dobrze skomponowane niczym na holenderskiej plantacji tulipanów. Dobre piwo.

Bouteille 33. Rouge foncée limpide à mousse beige abondante. Nez plutôt discret au départ avec odeurs de caramel et de fruits (cerise, prune). Bouche gouleyante, un peu sucrée (candi), légèrement surette et allant sur le fruit et les herbes avec une légère amertume et une bonne carbonatation. Bonne mais, pour moi, pas au niveau des autres Trappe. Il faut dire que je ne suis pas très bock !

Det er ikke fordi den er dårlig.. man forventer bare mere.. gær smagen er der, men især i duften er den tilstede. Jeg ville ikke tage til Holland efter den, Danmark og England laver rigtige gode mørke øl.. drik dem ??

Bottle from Vrutak. Tasting at Brnjas place. Thanks! Murky to opaque dark amber, moderate lasting off-white head. Cherry, caramel, candy, toasty, syrup, cake. Very roasty and dry. Medium to full body, very smooth, medium carbonation, lasting dry finish. Very nice, Im surprised by the balance.
Bottle at Cafe Rose Red, 11th February 17. Pours dark brown, great white head, Aroma is roasted malts, dark fruit, molasses, some smoke. Taste is rich, dark fruit, sugar, slight molasses. Nice stuff
Flaska från Saveur Bieré. Smak och doft av karamell, jäst, bröd, torkad frukt, brunt socker, trä med toner av körsbär. Fin maltsötma, torr, rund och len, fruktig, fin balans och beska.

Gekocht bij Dranken Maes in Dendermonde op 10-10-2016. En geproefd op 28-1-2017. La Trappe - Bockbier is een kastanje-kleurig tot donker-bruin en helder biertje. Bij het uitschenken krijg je veel amber-beige kleurig schuim met een dik wollige structuur dat stabiel blijft tot je begint te drinken. Het blijft ook sterk aan het glas kleven. Als je dan begint te proeven en dus ook het schuim aanraakt blijft er tamelijk vlug slechts een dun en fijn gelijkmatig laagje over. Toch kan je met enige moeite een middelmatige CO2 verzadiging zien met middelmatig grootte belletjes. Het aroma van La Trappe - Bockbier is vooral moutig, karamel en koffie inbegrepen. Ook in de verte iets wat op noten lijkt. De smaak is vooral zoetig en dan wat bitterig, zoethout en gebrande koffiemout komen ook voorbij. In de mond geeft La Trappe - Bockbier toch niet helemaal een volle smaak, het hangt ergens tussen vol en medium volmondigheid. Verder is hij wat bitterdroog en kwa textuur gaat hij wat richting waterig. La Trappe - Bockbier is normaal kwa CO2 prikkeling maar door de direkte bitterheid in de nasmaak heeft La Trappe - Bockbier toch een samentrekkend totaalgevoel in de mond. De nasmaak vloeit uit en is direkt bitter, daarna ook een klein beetje zoetig. 3.3, nog een goede score, vooral dankzij de gebrande koffiemout en het zoethout in de smaak.

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki
Pours dark brown with a sticky frothy head. Absolutely beautiful! Aroma of caramel, sweet malts and dark fruits. Taste is a nice mixture of sweet maltiness, caramel, dates, chestnut and yeasty spiciness. Medium bodied, light hoppiness, surprisingly bitter finish. Top points for appearance, but otherwise average beer at best. I have no idea what makes this a Bock, for it tastes like a Dubbel to me! :)

Pours a lovely deep red with nice cream head. A dare I say beautiful beer?
Smells of treacle, molasses and soaked raisins. Lovely.
Tastes very malty and bitter with a lingering sweetness. Strong alcohol aftertaste. A deep and complex beer which I really ought to love, but just doesnt quite do it for me.
Still grows on you the further down the glass you go.

Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into a mug.
Appearance: Deep blurry red/brown colour, with rich creamy head. 
Aroma: Dry plums and raisin, caramel, toffee, hint of alcohol
Palate: Full body, moderate carbonation. 
Taste: Light sweetness, caramel, cookies/brownies, moderate bitter aftertaste with alcohol note. 
Overall impression: Very enjoyable and tasty.
Boca 0.33L - Kaufland - pomalo suho u ustima, okus karamele, tamna amber boja
Bottle. Brown color with tanned head. Aroma has caramel, malt, dark fruits, nuts. Taste is malty sweet with long a bit dry aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, dark malt, bread, dark fruits and nuts.

Pours tawny dark brown from the bottle. The head is thick and creamy. A light lacing clings to the glass. The aroma is a convoluted mix of bubblegum, fig, and rootbeer float. Taste follows nose with an overall sweet entry that delves into bubble gum, sour cherry and chocolate all at once. The overall effect unfortunately seems more artificial than natural and is worsened as we slide into a flat chemical toxicity that permeates through the finish and leaves an, uh, disagreeable impression. Palate is on the light side of medium. This feels like a worthwhile stab at the best of German and Begian styles. A typical inter-european cooperation - a great ideal, a promising start, but sort of a mess.
Copied from iOS app. No review available. Beer connected to ratebeer account.

Bruin kleurig bier met een aroma van: fruitig, wat geroosterde mout.

Smaak is: geroosterde mout, wat fruitig, karamel en noten.

Pours dark brown with ruby shades and tan head. Aroma is very fruity: plums, dates, figs, chestnut, earthy hops. Same in the mouth, nicely balanced. Soft to medium carbonation, medium body and almost sticky mouthfeel.
Dark brown, large beige head. Aroma dark malt, liqueur. Taste light sweet, yeast, dark fruit, caramel, alcohol hint.
33cl bottle at home. Pours dark brown with beige head. Caramel malt, sugar, hint of dark fruits. Nice body, not too complicated and not too sweet for my taste. Quality.

Dark red with creamy strong beige head.

Aroma: dark malt, prunes, spicy hops.
Taste: moderate to light sweet with some tartness and light hoppy bitterness.
Flavour: prunes, roasted oat nutty notes, prominent spicy and grassy hops.

Suprisingly bitter finish.

Very good.
Bottle from Real Ale Newark. Rich deep ruby colour with a foamy pale tan head. Aroma is very light toffee and fruit. Taste starts mid sweet to sweet toffee finish. Surprisingly light body.
Force awaken ja sapsu. Tontut unilla ja isän kanssa jouluelokuva. Ei hullumpi, mutta ei suosikki.

Bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a huge tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, yeast, candy sugar, light fruit. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, malty caramel, yeast, light wood, fruit. Medium body, average carbonation, light sweet finish. 271216
Mooi paarsrood. Veel schuim. Ruikt kruidig, smaakt kruidig. Beetje teveel in de smaak.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with huge foamy beige head. Aroma has malt, yeast, some caramel. Taste also has strong maltiness with some yeast and caramel. Even has some nice bitterness. Pretty good beer for dark winter/autumn evenings!
0,33l from Alko. Pours deep brown colour. Aroma of malt, burnt sugar, caramel, nuts, dried fruits. Medium to light body, doesnt get too light though.
Tap. Ruby color with tan head. Aroma is molasses, prunes. Taste is more prunes, brown sugar, and molasses. Boozy slightly warming finish. Oily mouthfeel. Good Bock!

Mild smell of chocolate. Very dark brown colour, extreme brown head. Aroma of oak, rye, malt, some nuts. Plentiful carbon. Mildly sweet. Surprisingly light body, slightly oily texture. Balanced and nice, but maybe even too light for a bock.
Piwo ciemnobrązowe, piana dość obfita, dość trwała, symbolicznie lepi szkło. W aromacie słodko, głównie karmel. W smaku równie słodko, karmel, tosty. Średnia pełnia. Wysycenie średnie.

Ambrée très sombre limite brune avec une grosse mousse dense ivoire/beige... Nez gourmand et épicé : miel, caramel, pain dépice, chocolat au lait et café, zest de citron vert, poivre, vanille, pruneau, mirabelle, poire, crème de marron, malts bien torréfiés... On sent bien lalcool qui révèle pleinement les arômes. On décèle aussi de bons houblons avec des notes de bois (cèdre, pin) et de cuir. Très belle complexité, nez hyper intéressant ! Il manquera un peu de profondeur sur les agrumes, mais les arômes sont magnifiques. La carbonatation est moyenne, lalcool assez tranquille en bouche. A propos de bouche, la première gorgée est très surprenante : texture souple, arômes de café très impressionnants, un côté fumé très intéressant et une amertume ferme et maîtrisée. On retrouve le petit côté charcuterie fumée (bacon) des bières fumées, mais de manière plus subtile. Petite sécheresse en fin de bouche très agréable. Les levures sont très perceptibles et ce dès le début. Les saveurs herbacées apparaissent sur le final. On discerne aussi des saveurs quon retrouve dans les Gueuse et les Lambic avec ce côté acidulé de la fermentation naturelle. Surprenant ! Très beaux malts et très beaux houblons, dose dalcool ni trop ni trop peu, côté fumé et Gueuse/Lambic inattendu : bière splendide, qui naura comme seul défaut que de manquer un peu de fruit en bouche. Santé ! Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

(Flasche) Es hat eine dunkelbraune Farbe mit einem starken rubinroten Einstich, ist unfiltriert mit einer bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist malzig, leicht röstig, mit Karamell und Trockenpflaume. Der Geschmack ist erstaunlich schlank, röstig mit Karamell und im Abgang kommt die Röstnote stark durch und endet in einer kräftigeren Bittere. Im Nachgeschmack dominiert findet sich eine angenehme Note von Zartbitterschokolade.
Trübes rötlichbraun mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, Röstaromen, Karamell, leicht süßlich, leicht fruchtig, nussig, süffig.

Donker robijnrood, crèmekleurige volle foamy schuimkraag, troebel.
Aroma: Geroosterde mout, donker fruit, karamel, gist, iets kruidig, licht koffie.
Smaak: Fruitig als een Belgische dubbel.... donker fruit, moutig en geroosterd, koffie en chocolade hint, karamel zoet, kruidig en florale bitter...iets prikkerig, zoethout.
Ik vind de bitter erg prettig... niet heel zoet.
Prima in balans. 
Medium body, prikkelig en aktief mondgevoel, afdronk is droog en geroosterd bitter.
Goeie Bock  met een Belgische hint. Top!
Mahtava bock. Hiiva, karamellisuus ja maltainen tumma maku on runsas, kevyt ja raikas sopivan happokuuden ansiosta. Hieno, täyteläinen olut.

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with medium sized off-white head. Aroma has yeast, malts, caramel and dried fruits. Taste is yeast, dried fruits, some Belgian hops and caramel. Some bitterness. Quite carbonated. Great bockbier!

Pours hazy ruby/amber color with beige head. Medium body and carbonisation, fair lacing. Complex, but rich grassy and citrusy aroma with notable hints of dark fruit (figs), brown sugar/caramel/molasses, smoke, bread, barley, yeast, cloves and toffee. Its taste starts with cherry and other sour malty flavors, continues in a honey-like sweetness and ends in a bitter, smokey and dry fruit-influenced finish. Mouthfeel is rich (but little dry), creamy and smooth. Great bockbier! One of the best Ive had.
Шикарно& темное пиво, хороший сладков& аромат и сбаланс& мягкий вкус и горчинк& отлично& Алкогол& 7%, а пьется очень легко и приятно. Дата розлива 20.04.2015. (Bottle 0,33/ 7%)
Bottle. Nice app with lasting foam. Aroma is malt and yeasty fruits. Taste is also malts and fruits from the yeast (pear and apple) toghether with some cara and raisins.
Belle couleur rouge sombre avec ce quil faut de mousse. Petite amertume et On sent lalcool en fin de gout. Un peu sucrée. Une bonne bière mais rien de spécial non plus
Sweet aroma. Head quickly dropped. At first rather sweet than bitter. Then bitterness settles in. Stingy carbonation.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy amber/caramel brown color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have sweet malts, caramel, brown sugar, Belgian fruity character, light bitterness, medium bodied, decent enough.
Bottle at home.Very dark chestnut cookout, foamy beige head. Dry and herbal, roasted malty dried fruits. Medium body, high carbonation.

30 cl bottle, served in snifter. Poured hazy dark red with a three finger tan head. Aroma: bread, caramel, raisins, forest fruit, nuts. Taste: caramel, fudge, toffee, milk chocolate, roasted nuts, herbs, dark fruit, raisins, dark roasted malts. Creamy, foamy mouthfeel. Medium body with a roasted bittersweet finish. Very nice bock!

Brown color pour from a bottle shared. Notes of ash, rye, plum, bread pudding, and prunes. Classic belgian type notes but more aggressive and astringent on the palate. Some soy sauce. Not sure about these dutch bocks..
Bottle. Dark ruby head with a big beige head. Sweet malty aroma of dried fruits, figs, sugar. Spicy taste, malty and not that bitter.

piękny aromat, mnóstwo miodu, kremowość w zapachu, skórka od chleba, zaskakująco dużo chmielu. w smaku dość chmielowe, melanoidynowe. słodki smak szybko kontruje gorycz przypominająca najpierw karmel ale później pozostawia posmak spalenizny, który mnie się kojarzy z przypalonymi warzywami z grilla.

Buena cerveza muy agradable tanto al inocio como al final del trago con un carbonico justo pero q permite una espuma de muybuennivel y color. Interesantes aromas dulces y un sauve amargor q no languidece. La he acompañado de un uiso de pulpo y me ha parecido agradable. La recomendaria sin lugar adudas. Mejora al llevar 5 min abierta y toma una temperatura mas suave

Bottle shared at home. Dark ruby-brown with a tall tan head. Notes of dried fruit - plums, raisins, figs - resinous spices (like rosemary), yeast, candi sugar, bitter herbs, light milk chocolate and coffee. Medium body, high carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish.

Aroma of dried figs, colour rich brown with a marvellous fluffy beige head that stays with you. Some rich bock malts coming through but taste is a little dull and cant make its way through the thickness of the beer. Not a proper bock for me and rate it lower than the German lagers. They should stick to dubbels and tripels which are their forte.
Deep amber with a big beige head. Aroma is apples, chocolate, caramel, honey, biscuit. Taste is caramel, honey, boscuit, some fruity and herbal notes. Sweet aftertaste.

Bottle 750ml cellared for approximately 1-2 years. Served at room temperature. Pours dark murky brown with a ruby tint. Head is medium sized, lightly tanned, foamy and lasts well. Aroma is rich and complex; lightly toasted raisin bread, dates, overripe dark plums, burnt brown sugar, rum liquor chocolates, cinnamon and aniseed. Flavour is slightly vinous with a light-to-medium toasty/roasted bitterness; toasted wholemeal bread, plums, blackcurrants, prunes, dark chocolate liquorice sticks, cooked brown sugar, dried leaves (light) and hints of burnt wood in the finish. Medium-to-full bodied with medium carbonation and a long toasty finish.
Interesting aroma kick, strong maltiness, some toasted caramel, licorice, dried fruits, yeast aspect, wood. Moderate to light sweetness, light bitterness, bit empty on finish, but nice anyways

Appearance- murky, mahogany-brown, a thick 2-3 finger light brown head which lasts. Aroma- lots of raisin, brown bread, malt, brewers yeast, dark fruit, banana hints. Taste- brown bread, malty, toffee and caramel, nutty hints, banana cake, fruitcake. Fluffy mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Nut brown color and lots of thick offwhite head. Looks nice. Aroma of bread, cellar aromas and a light raisin sweetness. Great taste with light sweetness up front and a good portion bitterness following along with toasty and nutty flavors. I really enjoy the great balance between it all. Palate is thick and dry with high carbonation. One of the best bocks Ive had. But maybe not a typical bock since this is an ale. Tasted very bocky though.

I had this at Global Brew. Pour brown with a tan head. Taste caramel, dark fruit, burnt/sweet. I thought this was ok. I could drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Punaiseen häivähtävä tummanruskea olut paksulla, kuohkealla beigellä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa maltaista toffeemaista makeutta ja hedelmää. Maku myös maltaisen makea ja hieman paahteinen jälkipuoleltaan. Hiilihappoja yllättävän reilusti, mutta tuntuu toimivan kokonaisuudessa. Nautittu lähes huoneenlämpöisenä. Ei huippu, mutta ei La Trappelta oikeastaan tämän enempää (tai vähempää) odotakaan. Taattua laatua.

Bottle. Clear deep brown colour with a quite large tan head, nose is sweet, a bit yeasty/sourish and full of roasted malts, toffee, banana and some metallic notes, taste is very roasty, a bit sweet and unusually sour for a bock with a moderately dry finish.

Bottle @Det Bette Ãlhus. Amber with an off white head. Some lacing and medium carbonation. Aroma is caramel, dark fruits, yeast and malt. Sweet with faint burned notes and a slightly bitter finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Global Brew. Pours a cloudy dirty brown with a very thin light tan head. Vanilla aroma. Taste is sweet caramel malt, buttered crackers, maple syrup and a bit of coffee. Mild bitterness at the swallow. Quite a good interpretation.

Piana wysoka i sztywna. Kolor bardzo ciemnej herbaty, brązowy z rubinowym refleksem. Zapach całkiem miły, piernik, owoce leśne. Smak lekko palony, nieznacznie odczuwalny też alkohol, generalnie wytrawne, trochę trawy, cytrusów, rodzynki. Goryczka umiarkowana, szybko opadająca, ale utrzymująca się krótko.
Bottle at home. Dark red-brown with a beige head, ok lacings. Aroma medium malty (caramel, roasted, dark berries). Flavor medium sweet, dark berries, spicy. Medium body, soft carbonated.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2016 Bardzo dobry Dunkler Bock łagodny w smaku z wuczuwalną nutą kawy i karmelu.

Very good Dunkler Bock mild in flavor with a hint of coffee and caramel .
Hatalmas, örökké tartó hab, sötétbarna szín. Illata enyhe, karamelles és fűszeres. Íze kávés, csokis, enyhe komlós keserűvel, pici alkoholossággal. Testes sör, közepes szénsavtartalommal.

330ml bottle. Dark red-brown colour, creamy tan foam head leaving lots of lacing and aroma of malt, milky, berry, currant. Rich flavour, malt, bready, grain, some sweetness with hints of dark fruits, berry, spic and, earthy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry tangy finish. Nicely drinkable.

330ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Hazy dark brown ruby colour with a two finger tan head, good lacing on the glass. Aroma is rich and malty, dark fruits, spices, caramel. Taste also rich and malty, spices, caramel, fruits, alcohol. Smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Bitterness in the finish and some alcohol. Very nice but wouldnt want more than one.

Color: Tono castaño con una capa de espuma amarillenta.

Aroma: Aromas característicos de cebada tostada, café y frutos secos.

Sabor: Esta cerveza única de temporada tiene un sabor seco, tostado y especiado y un fuerte amargor que se funde de forma sorprendente con un tono subyacente de regaliz.

Regusto: Agridulce, regusto seco a café tostado de larga duración.

Características
La única cerveza trapense bock del mundo

La Trappe Bockbier es una cerveza bock de doble fermentación, 100% malta, elaborada con diversos granos. La Trappe Bockbier es la única bock trapense del mundo.
Se elabora con ingredientes exclusivamente naturales y fermenta un poco más en la botella. Esta cerveza única de temporada es de color rojo intenso, sabor pleno y aroma a malta. Los distintos tipos de lúpulo aromático y las maltas bien tostadas proporcionan un agradable amargor que se funde de forma sorprendente para el paladar con un gusto subyacente ligeramente dulce.

Bottle from Borresteijn. Thanks. It pours clear ruby dark brown with a creamy beige head. The aroma is deep malty with toffee and caramel notes. Light smoked notes. Caramel malty flavor. Light chocolate and faint hops. Hint of smoke. Some bread in the finish.

Ottima birra. Dal bellissimo colore mogano abbastanza scuro e limpido, schiuma marroncino chiaro, fine, abbondante e persistente. Laroma è gradevole, maltato, marzapane.In bocca è molto buona, con gli stessi sentori che al naso. Ancora una volta La Trappe ha fatto centro!

F: big, long lasting, pale brown.
C: dark ruby to brown, hazy.
A: malty, dark bread, toast, dark caramel, burned sugar, yeast.
T: rich malty, bready, caramel, dark sugar, roasted malt, fruity, fig, quite complex, hint of dry on the palate, full body, lower carbonation, worth to try beer, 0,33l bottle from Beer Mania in Brussels.
Flesje thuis gedronken. Robijnrood helder bier met weinig schuim. Aroma is caramel achtig. Smaak is fruitig en caramelachtig. Nasmaak is hoppig en zoet

Pours dark copper color with creamy looking beige head. Refreshingly sweet smell of caramel, toffee and fruits.

Full body with soft carbonation. Nice texture, thick and oily. Taste is sweet. Aroma of caramel, toffee, dark fruit and berries, nuts and spices. Traces of alcohol towards the finish. 

Overall, excellent brew. Pure class.

Bottle at home. Pours a clear red-brown with a tan head and good lacing. Nice aroma of roasted malt, bready yeast with a herbal hop background. Tastes sweet to start but a good balance of bitterness. Rich, malty mouthfeel with flavours of red fruits and fig. Dry, lasting finish. Pretty good.

Tap in the Trembling Madness, York. Pours mahogany with a good thick foamy cream head. Fruity aroma. Teh taste is full and fruity. Red fruits, light spice and toffee. A touch of coffee in the bitter finish. Nice.
Draft. Aroma of figs, roasted nuts and a small amount of smoke. Dark ruby red body with thin head. Flavor is plum, dried fruit, honey and a malty backbone. Slightly sweet mouthfeel.

Robe très sombre et mousse épaisse brune. Très équilibrée du début à la fin. Malt grillé. On est sur le pain toasté avec une jolie amertume subtile. Bière sèche caractéristique de son style. Très bonne bière de repas sur des plats un peu chargés.

Butelka 0,75l Kolor ciemnobrązowy, klarowny, piana jasnobeżowa, mocna, trzyma się dobrze, zostawia ślady na szkle. Aromat drożdżowy z cytrusami, w smaku karmel i słodycz. Wysycenie średnie alkohol świetnie ukryty. Dominuje karmel i słodycz.
Bottle. Deep copper color with tiny white head. Aroma - Malty, dried fruit, honey. Taste - Sweet, caramel, dried fruit, bread, yeast.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2016 Huge, light brown with yellowish tint head on top of a dark brown with suble red notes pour. Starts great. Heavy carbonation which is barely noticeable due to the amazing aroma of the hops. Bitterness is amazingly well masked, taste is well balanced, not too strong roasted malt, not too much caramel, just the ideal amount. Dark dried fruits, some hints of smoked plums and toasted bread. Aftertaste is somewhat sweet, yet with subtle bitter notes. Amazing beer!
Piwo ciemnobrązowe, piana dość obfita, dość trwała, symbolicznie lepi szkło. W aromacie słodko, głównie karmel. W smaku równie słodko, karmel, tosty. Średnia pełnia. Wysycenie średnie.
notes de chocolat, caramel, épices, amertume en fin de bouche. Pas fan du style à titre personnel, mais passe assez bien en fin de soirée/repas

DAA; Bottle, drunk at Melkebaren. Poured huge, dark brown with a lasting creamy, lacing and lasting head. Nose is moderate, toasted malt, caramel, rasin bread, spice and light spice. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitter with a warming, fruit, lasting finish. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy, carbonation is flat.
0.33 bottle, earthy brown color, big tan head. Very malty and caramel aroma. Rich sweet and little bitter taste, alcohol well hidden. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Good beer.

Bottle 33 cl. Reddish-bronze color, good foam. Aroma: very sweet, rich maltiness, caramel, toffee, plum jam, dried fruit, porto. Taste: sweet, malty, wine, candy, candies, dried fruits, sparkling, medium dry finish.

Tap at Erzbierschof Zürich. Its quite ironic that 2 days after importing and rating my first Dunkler Bock, there now is one in my usual craft beer bar. Anyway, this one is clearly much better. Floral nose, thick malty taste, dark but not roasty. Fine but well-matched carbonation. Quite sweet, but still not heavy, not your usual heavy bock to warm yourself in winter. Very nice!
Amazing Bock. Very rich taste and aroma. Tasted it from 750ml bottle with cork cap. Very good foam head and head retention. Will drink this beer any time again.

Soupy in appearance and a benign aroma - but what a taste! It takes me back to childhood. Not because I was drinking as an 8 year old, but because it smacks of the jersey caramels my grandmother used to buy as treats. A lovely drop.

Pours brown with beige head. Nose enjoying it a lot. Aroma has a lot of different shades - blackcurrant, cinnamon, a lot of caramel, brown bread, lemon, some tea plants. Taste is following and adding some yeast and toasted bread. Good beer with nice long after!

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Norway, on order (bu). Brown color, good foam. Medium/high aroma intensity; malt, dried fruits, light honey and figue. Medium body & complexity. Somw sweetness, balances very well. Very enjoyable

Bottle. BB 10.2015 (Hadnt noticed that...) Pours dark brown with a bright red glimmer against light; the head is big, creamy, well retaining, leaving strong lace. The aroma is sweet, malty, sourish, bready, roasty. Tastes sweet and roasty, with a sourish berry-like continuation and dry earthy bitter finish. Almost no carbonation, quite silky on the palate. Nice.

Pours a brown head with malty, caramel and candy aromas. Faint hops. Dark brown colored body. Thin in mouth but with present roasted malt taste. Bitter aftertaste. Medium length. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Drank this at the monestary itself combined with the best steak I have ever eaten in my life. The meal was in great harmony and so was the beer. A real must for bock lovers.
Fine beer, but a little soft, alcohol percentage a little too low, may be 8,5% or around would be suitable.
A nice trappist bock, that has a full bodied taste with nice pleasant bitter tones.

33cl bottle on 28-Dec-2015., poured into a stemmed tulip glass. Reddish brown colour with a frothy tan coloured head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel and hops. Medium body and soft carbonation. Bitterness upfront followed by sweet malt, bread, Belgian yeast and hops. Light spiciness, and not overly sweet. A nice fresh well balanced hoppy Bock.

Bottle from Belgian Beer Factory. Pours slightly murky reddish brown. Nose is malty, sweet, raisins, caramel, spices. Taste is spicy malty, light bitter, dried fruits, dark bread, toffee, finish is bitter rather than sweet. In a way it is unique and complex, still not sure if this works so well though.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of caramel, raisins and yeast. Flavor was slightly sweet with dried fruit, caramel, raisins, dark bread and toffee.

0.33l bottle. Orangish dark brown body, tan head. Aroma of caramel, orange peel, some banana, cherries and toast. Taste of caramel, toast, orange zest, Belgian yeast and a nice amount of hop bitterness in the end of the sip. Very nice.

Bottle 0,33l. Poures a clear dark brown colour with an average to large frothy tan head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Malty aroma. Moderate toasted sweet flavor with a medium sweet malt finish of average duration. Medium to full body with a smooth sticky texture.

330ml Bottle - Dark brown with orangey red tinges. Malt, brown sugar and raisins in the aroma. Fruity, malty and moderately sweet taste with malt, raisins and caramel.
Uma boa cerveja, mas esperava mais de uma sozonal da La Trappe. Mas vale a pena pelo preço.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

750ml bottle. Unfiltered amber-brown body. Massive creamy beige head, steady, laces the glass. Burnt coffee grounds, brown chocolate, caramel malt tones. Earthy dry hop balance. Creamy on the palate, world class mouthfeel. A very Dutch beer, this doesnt capture the lager notes I would hope for in a Bock. Quite excellent still, a unique beer.
33cl Bottle at home. Bottle from Albert Heyn. Zoete herfstbladeren. Backlog from 2015/02/28.
Very long tan head. Malty aroma. Lack of sweetness like other bock beers. Long bitterness aftertaste.
28.11.2015-0,3l Flasche.Hellbraun-rötlicher Körper mit gigantischer, sehr fester, länger anhaltender Krone. Aroma erdig, hefig, alkoholisch,Antrungk hefig, trocken, leicht röstmalzig.

This pours a cloudy, medium brown color with a foamy brown head. The aroma is sweet full of malts and hints of spice. The flavor is thick full of nutty, plum, dried fruit flavors. Very yeasty, lots of carbonation with a bitter finish.
From a 75 cl bottle shared at the OBX on Thanksgiving. Pours a cloudy brown with a tan head. Slightly metallic aroma. Flavors of toffee and leather. Bitter finish.

Vol van smaak, heerlijk bitter in de nasmaak. Licht troebel, donkerrood tot bruin bier met een smaakexplosie bij de eerste slok. Even wennen dus.

Ik ben geen fan van bockbieren maar ik vondt deze opzich wel te doen. Hij is wat zoetig en toch bitter in de nasmaak. Mooie diepe rode kleur met normale schuimkraag erop. Smaken van karamel en noten zijn subtiel verwerkt in het bier. Voor de bockliefhebber is dit een echte aanrader.

Bottle. Poured clear dark brown with an average to large frothy tan head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Solid toasted malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth sticky texture. Moderate toasted sweet flavor with a medium sweet malt finish of average duration. Good brew with spicy food.

Un bellissimo colore tra ambra scuro e marrone con note rossastre, bellissima schiuma beige pannosa, bello anche il perlage. Aroma tipico delle bock, dolce con note fruttate. Al palato buonissima, corposa, maltata con un bel caramello. Cremosa e carbonazione giusta. Una bock da ricordare.

33cl bottle at home. pours a darkbrown amber colour with a big tan head lasts fairly long. aromas of red fruits, malt, brown sugar. taste is slight sour with a nice bitterness to it with notes of red fruits, malt, brown sugar, plums and caramel. texture is a bit creamy with medium carbonation.
From elcervecero. In La Trappe chalice. Watching Vikings 2x09. Great in all aspects. It has that caramel touch i loved in aventinus eisbock but softer and delicious too.
Mijn favoriete bockbier. Mooie volle schuimkraag, subtiele geur en goed gebalanceerde smaak.

Enige trappisten bock bier ter wereld. Geweldige rood/bruine kleur. Smaakt echt lekker. Weinig geur maar lekkere zoete, zachte smaak met mooie schuimkraag. Neigt wat naar noten en caramel. Zeker een aanrader!

Finishing off lunch sampler now I need some coffee! Reddish brown pour beige head. Nose is dark fruits and brown sugar. Tastes of dates, plum, molasses, earthy bitter, candied sugar, and malt. Chewy mouthfeel. Warm body.
Bottle 30cl. Dark brown /red with a big light brown head. Nice aroma of malt, nkt sweet but plesant. Well hopped to make a nice impression. Definitely one of the best Dutch bok biers.
Definitively a great beer! Good chocolate and honey taste. Heavy but nice intense taste.

Lightly toasty, caramel, honey, herbal aroma. Beautiful red color, frothy white-brown head. Medium sweet, light-medium bitterness. Creamy texture, average carbonation, bitter finish. Good bock - perfect for dinners with meat.

Bottle sample at a tasting Thanks Vova. BBD 10/2011. Clear amber brown with a creamy head. Aroma of dried fruits, candy, prunes, honey, Belgian yeast. Very sweet honey-ish flavors, oxidized and boozy. Medium-bodied.

330ml bottle at home. Poirs a dark amber color with a big head. Nice and bitter with earthy tones.

Poured to an event shaker at the WCD Trade Expo in Chicago, showing a deep copper color, with a frothy layer of soft white head foam, and spots & streaks of lacing. Alcohol poked its head out in the aroma, but remained rather hidden in the flavor. No matter,... tasty nonetheless.
red, brown, clear, tan foam, caramel, toast, roasty, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,

Bottle 0,33.
Copper color, minimal head. Medium body. Aroma: malts, caramel. Taste: roasted, nuts, bready. Overall: good, well balanced beer.
Bottle, 330 ml from Vrutak, Zagreb. pours dark amber with beige head. Roasted malts, caramel, nuts, bit yeasty, sugar. Nice one. Quite good.

Shared 750ml to chalices. Caramel brown pour with mountainous tan head. Carbonation is soft though. Aroma of bread and caramel and yeast. Thin and quite sweet up front. Nice noble bite on the end.

33cl bottle. Dark brown colour with an one finger off-white head. Caramel, bread and nuts in the aroma. Average to soft carbonation and medium body. Taste is more on the sweet side with light bitter notes. Overall, a good beer.

Robe brune, légèrement ambrée. Mousse bien. Saveurs de malt torréfié, fumé, fruits noirs, houblon et levure. Beaucoup desters. Arrière goût café, légèrement vanillé. Texture épaisse, carbonatation fine.

Pours deep amber with fluffy head. Toffee / caramel nose, good mouthfeel medium carbonation. Slightly sweet caramel and toffee balanced by the bitterness. Good drinking

Draft at Ei8ht Ball, served in a taster. Pours a cloudy amber with an off-white head that laces the glass and leaves some bubbles and film behind. Notes of banana, brown sugar, earth, leaves, caramel, candi sugar, and dried fruits. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel that finishes dry. Good dunkler bock.

Medium offwhite creamy head with larger bubbles. Dark red body. Light, roasty licorice aroma. Taste is deep, intense sweet roastiness with licorice notes. Very harmonic and balanced. Dry licorice aftertaste. Hoppy notes, and a touch of coffee
Deep reddish/brown pour. Tan head. Nice and malty, sweet dried fruits, yeasty goodness. Some vanilla and toffee notes.
Smell is malt, Belgian yeast, and esters. Taste is pretty much the same and finishes semi-dry. Medium to full body, medium carbonation, and slight foam.

0,33 bottle purchased at the Beerville store in Belgrade-Serbia. Ciao Vlada! Pours amber-brown, huge ivory foam which stays there tick and consistent. Nice appearance, good shape. 33 cl bottle. Pours a brown color with a medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malts and grassy hops. Taste is sour with roasted bread and caramel notes. Medium body and lively carbonation. A sweet finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.33l from Beerville Beer shop Belgrade Serbia.Ciao Vlada! Pour it dark reddish color with medium white head.On the nose liquer.Taste and aroma of hibiscus, dark fruits, sweet plum on the back, quite soft and very drinkable. Good balanced bock.
A nice bock, but nothing very special, which is something one would expect from a La Trappe (at least I would).

Australian dirty colour of the wonderful big and stable top. You can use the knife to make slices. Cloudy burnt caramel brown red Trappist bock ale. Full body, medium carbonation. Nutty, aromatic hopes, caramel, cinnamon. Good on all fronts.
Dark brown with medium beige head. Dry roasted malt bitterness and sourness with chocolate and coffee notes. Some touch of vanilla. Bitter aftertaste.

33 cl. bottle poured in to a Snifter. Dark brown colour with a big, tanned head. Sweet aroma with overripe, dark fruits, roasted malts, caramel malts, earthy notes. Liquorice and a herbal bitterness. Dark reddish brown colour. Smell od roasted malts, dark fruits, dark chocolate, banana, plums and caramel. The same is flavour with little bitter - malty aftertaste. Surly one of the most represantative beers of this style.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Fles. Amberrood, donker. Zoete walm. Stevige schuimkraag. Aromas zijn rode druiven, pruimen, gedroogd rood fruit, klein beetje bubblegum, klein beetje ipa hop (lychee, ananas). 0,75 l bottle from Wijnkoperij Bartels in Zwolle. Clear, dark ruby with a foamy, stable, tan head. Tetszetős küllemű bak a La Trappe háza tájáról, mely nem csak kinézete által, de illatában és ízében is rendkívül kellemes benyomást tesz fogyasztójára. Egy barnás-rezes színű, krémes, bézs habkoronájú test bontakozik ki a pohárba töltve, majd selyemcukros, gyümölcsrágós illatokkal festi be a teret, melyek mögött narancsos, marcipános, karamelles és természetesen malátás jegyek sejlenek fel. Közepes szénsavtartalommal, gabonás, tejkaramellás, gyümölcsös-alkoholos összetevők alkotta vonulattal indul, mely egy jól behatárolható, belga élesztős jelleg mentén körvonalazódik, ami viszont ez esetben remekül harmonizál a bak sörök karakterisztikájával. Kesernyés komló zárja a képet, amely egyébként tökéletes egyensúlyban van az ital élesztős, szárított gyümölcsös hangulatával.

Seule bière trappiste du style bockbier, titrant à 7 % abv. Bouteille de 75 cl, bouchonnée en version
synthétique, extrêmement difficile et lent à ouvrir.
En dehors du mérite de sortir cette bière, on ne sait pas très bien où des trappistes ont pu 
prendre la recette... du bouc...
Couleur brun foncé assez joli, roux en transparence, et noir quand elle est exposée au soleil couchant.
Clarté nette. Bulles par milliers partout très vives.
Mousse beige moyen bien épaisse.
Arômes très restrictifs de pain bis et caramel.
1ère bouche souple sur des céréales (il y en a 3 dans la composition : orge, froment et avoine),
un rien de café et du chocolat noir.
Arrière-bouche avec une amertume sans distinction.
2ème sur de lavoine grillée, herbe à chat.
3ème un peu plus levurée, pointe de noisettes.
Arrière-bouche toujours très faible, juste torréfiée.
La longueur donne de plus jolis nez que les bouches, ces nez sont avec une douce levure.
Les bouches sont assez étroites ou « pincées », avec une amertume toujours banale.
La levure est très jolie au nez sur la longueur, on la dit, et au goût un peu limite, mais cest 
pour léquivalent dune double, donc on ne peut trop demander.
Lalcool est pauvre, mais comme on est devant une 75 cl, il arrive à chauffer un peu la finale.
Cette finale est un peu plus intégrée que le reste, mais pas plus complexe.
CONCLUSION : une bière brune qui sapparente plus à une double industrielle, qui titrerait vers
6 % abv, à lexception des nez de la longueur qui présentent de jolies senteurs levurées très 
agréables. Mais si on prend une bouteille de 75 cl bouchonnée, ce nest pas pour quelques nez
de la longueur....

Beetje karkaterloos voor een trappist, anderzijds naar mijn idee het beste bok(bock) bier van nederland. volle kraag, rond mondgevoel weiniog zoet (gelukkig maa) lekker bittertje, beetje chocolade. Drinkt goed door..

Malzig-süßer Geruch, hefig, Trockenfrüchte, leicht röstig. Malzig-süßer Anlauf. Mitte süß, Schokolade, Trockenfrüchte, hefig, Aprikose. Leicht mehliger, malzfruchtiger und süßer Abgang. Gut schmeckender Bock.

Bottle. Clear dark red-brown body and a huge tan coloured head. Aroma:taste of bread, toast and caramel with a fruity, bitter alcoholic body and a dry chocolatey finish. Light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Small bottle. Cloudy copper body, medium beige head. Aroma has sweet caramel with some spices and toffee. Taste has roasty malts with dried fruit and some yeast. Good mouthfeel. Finish is bitter but its kept in balance with the yeastiness and the dried fruit tastes. The first La Trappe out of the bunch that manages to exceed my expectations.

In short: A roasty juicy brown ale lacking personality.  Just ok.
How: Bottle 330ml, consumed a few months after receiving it from private importation.
The look: Brown body topped by a medium beige head with medium retention.
In long: Nose is very roasted, estery, a bit phenolic, toasted fruit cake.  Taste is roasted grainy cereals, dark and red berries, brown sugar cookies, some caramel, yeast, peanut shells, earthy notes, nougat, tobacco, ginger-like spiciness. A rather juidy body with sparse bubbles.  Nothing wrong with the list of flavor elements, however when all put together it was missing something.  Muted, dark, unexpressive.  Not a bad beer, just very forgettable.  I rarely like a beer from La Trappe, not sure what my problem is with this brewery.  Im entering this rating on dec 22 2012, apparently yesterday the world was supposed to end because of some Mayan calendar, I dont know what this is all about, I dont pay much attention to calendars that dont have bikinis.

Aroma agradable y bien llevado. Dulce y ligeramente acaramelizado, maltas tostadas y un poco de café. Notas frutales, principalmente uvas y pasas. Ligeras notas a nuez. 

Color obscuro con ciertos matices rojizos y rubis a contra luz. Carbonatación prácticamente nula, cuerpo medio. Cabeza de espuma de largar retención y buena estructura,

En boca  suave, con un buen equilibrio entre dulzor inicial y final amargo.

Al paladar su inicio es suave y elegante, cremoso. Sabores frescos y frutales ( manzana) con cierto final citrico.  Final medio, seco con ligero amargor.

En resumen una cerveza estilo bock agradable, cremosa, elegante, bien estructurada, disfrutable. Con un equilibrio bien logrado que permite equilibrar dulzor y amargon de principio a fin.

Many thanks to Finn for a 330ml bottle of this one. Poured into a snifter beer glass revealing a large, bubbly, tan-coloured head with fine duration. Fragile lacing to the glass. Unclear dark brown, ruby tinged body. Plums and earthy malts to the nose. Joyful flavour of herbs and dried fruits mingled with ripe banana and mild yeasty fruitiness followed by a bittersweet ending. Soft in the mouth. Well bodied. Nice (at home, Tromsø, 14.12.2012).
Bottle. Pours reddish brown with huge foam. Taste of malts, caramel. Long aftertaste. Very nice and balanced.
UPDATED: FEB 6, 2013 Bottle bb10/2015. Unfiltered brown colour. Sweat yeasty aroma with spicies. Sweat bitter taste. Have to buy more and cellarize.--Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark reddish brown, large thick head. Sweetish, malty aroma with bread, caramel, a hint of roastiness. Nicely balanced sweetness and bitterness. Long aftertaste.
The head is medium, the body brown, dark brown. It smells, alcoholic-creamy, fruity-bitter, The taste is alcoholic-fruity, creamy, fruity-sugary, a bit bitter. Ok! 11/11/11/12/11/11

csakajosor.hu
 Igen sötét vörösréz színe van, ami belül kissé ködös. Habja hatalmas, világosbarna, tömör, paplanszerű és igen kitartó. Illata karamellás, fűszeres, élesztős és aszalt gyümölcsös. Íze is hozza az aszalványokat, karamellízált mézet, malátát, jó adag élesztőt, fűszereket, gyógyfüveket és egy kis komlót. Közepesen testes, de nem nehéz és sűrűn van ellátva apró kis buborékokkal. Utóíze keserédes és száraz. Finom és különleges baksör a kesernyésebbek közül.
Brown. Sweet malts. It smells mushroom, metal, mould. It is a poor quality beer. Dont buy it!

Bottle. Amber, hazy, average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, caramel, some fruitiness and light roasted malt, light alcohol. Medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, caramel and some fruitiness - light dark fruits, light hoppyness and light alcohol. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, some caramel and light fruitiness, faint roasted malt and light hoppyness with some alcohol. Caramel sweetish bock.

#1428
Dunkelbraun, feiner bräunlicher Schaum. Hefig-fruchtiges Aroma nach Steinobst (Pflaume). Vollmundiger Geschmack nach Hefe und Mandel, schön würzig im Mittelpart. Klingt ungewöhnlich trocken-herb aus. Für ein Bockbier ziemlich herb geraten und nicht so klebrig süß. Gefällt mir!

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2014 330ml bottle (7+4+7+3+12=3,3). Dark copper color. Small off-white head, stays. Alcohol, caramel, dark fruits, raisins in aroma. Malty, creamy, very mild roast, raisins, yeast in flavor. Nice mellow roasty/raisins in aftertaste.
750ml bottle (shared by FatPhil), BB2010. Medium size, brown head, stays. Raisins, prunes, sweet, malty aroma. Sweet, moldy, raisins, prunes in taste. Absolutely fantastic.

Dark brown, a little lighter than a cola drink. A big beige head. Aromas of some citrus and bread. Quite sweet. Tastes a little like a sweet rye bread. Watery. Has some roasty bitterness in the after taste. Not quite my style of a beer.

Bottle. Pours reddish dark brown with a large, frothy head. Aroma has caramel maltiness, dark fruits, raisin and some yeasty spiciness. Interesting but unusual for a bock. Taste is even more unusual for a bock; it has sweetish maltiness, strong fruitiness, yeast and even a hint of crisp, floral hop aroma. Drying finish with grapefruit and some alcohol. Medium bodied and sticky. This doesnt seen like a bock at all but I enjoyed it all the same.

Bottle. Brown, dark mahogany. Sweet malts, some dark fruit, plums, raisins.   Dark candi. A bit like a dubbel, but not as rich and boozyer. Body is lghter than expected, and drier. Even as a bock not that great. A bit thin, not as warming as Id like. And as a la trappe, Im automatically looking for the yeasty esters that obviously arent there.-- bb/h
33cl bottle. Dark ruby color, thick white head. Dark fruity, bready, yeasty aroma. Similar flavor, quite boozy. Long sweetish, boozy finish. Did not work for me.

330 ml bottle. Cloudy reddish borown colour, thick light beige head. Sweetish malty aroma with dark fruits and spices. The flavour is toasted malty, with some banana and dark fruits and a toasted finish. Nice.
Quite metallic taste and some unfriendly bitterness. I love La Trappe, but they did not well with this bok. Disappointing experience, next time Ill stick to the dubbel.
Pours dark ruby with off-white head. Aroma of fruits, malt and spices. Flavour of fruits, malt, hops and spices.

A dark brown beer with a quite big and beige head. Aroma is rich and malty, dark fruits, anise, raisins and spice. Taste of dark fruits and dark bread, surprisingly dry, that enhanced by spices, also rye bread in the aftertaste. Medium bodied, lots of carbonation, that makes drinkability a slightly biting, smoother after a while. Dark fruits and dark bread, interesting combination, but execution isnt totally successfull. Basic and good beer.

33 cl, bottled. Pours dark ruby-brown with a beige head. Aroma: Malt, grainy. Dried fruits, vanilla, brown sugar. Toffee. Taste: Medium (+) sweet, light bread bitterness. Palate: Medium body, smooth. Little floury. Noticeable carbonation. Slightly bitter at the finish. Good.
Bottle 33 cl, BBE 10/2015. Ruby red in color with a creamy tan head. Sweet dark fruits, some banana and yeast in aroma. Dark bread and dark sweet fruits in taste.

Bottle, 12C. Very dark brown with a large fluffy beige head that fades to an inch and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is not all that strong until the head fades, but has dried and stewed fruits, spiced bread, singed dark sugars. Mouthfeel just short of syrupy with low carbonation. A bit chewy.  Suppose this is bottom fermented but I really wouldnt guess it to be. Quite a lot of bitterness straight away.  Earthy, maybe a little leathery with lots of dried dark fruits and their skins, berries, mild roasted coffee, dried banana, dark sugars, licorice. Enjoyable apart from the stubborn plastic cork.

Hazy ruby red to brownish color, frothy head 3 fingers and long and leaving lacing. Nice looks. Head covers aromas so wait a bit. Mild aroma has berries, cherry, raspberry, yeast, belgian esters, alcohol mildly. Nuanced and inviting aroma. Bit sweet and sour, ash, not much berries in flavor, more  dried fruits, spices, even bit pepper in medium long finish. Medium body, bit fizzy feel with spicy bite. Lots of character and nuances to enjoy, recommended.
Hazy dark brown body, khaki head. Aroma has nuts, butter, dark fruits and bready malt and banana. Flavour is much banana, raisins and bread. Is this lager or not? Not if you ask me.

33cl bottle -  Dark ruby-brown with a medium sized tan head that quickly recedes to a thin film. Fantastic aroma of malt, toffee, dark fruit, and a hint of spice. Full bodied without being sticky or cloying, very nice. Lovely, complex flavour - malt, caramel, brown sugar, dark dried fruit, toasted nuts - and a warm, lingering finish.
Bottle from Alko. Dark brown color, beige head. Malty taste with nuts, plum, earthy notes, bread, banana and malts. Sweet, malty finish with earthy notes. Excellent bock.
A nice and malty bockbeer with a nice and consistent body. The hint of caramel in this beer is great.
A deep amber color with a nice consistent head.  Very malty and with nice caramel tones.

Sunday 20 Oct 2012 sees me sat outside in bright sunlight: Valkenburg, Holland. I walk passed a board advertising La Trappe Bockbier on tap, I put myself into reverse and have two lovely glasses of this and watch the world go by.

Deep brown/ruby red in body colour: the sunlight dancing on the ruby tints. Large cream coloured head when brought to my table: soon turns into a wispy covering and collar (what a pity).

Malts and yeast esters vie for your smell senses with the malts easily winning. Add a hand full of crushed dark, red berries and a spoon full of all spice and youve got the aroma.

The malts rule the taste as well, malty molasses giving the beer a rich, smooth feel and flavour. Most likely the best Bock I had while on the trip. Another bar was having a Bock Fest and had around 8 on tap, so I managed to try a few, as you do!
Clear Darker ruby with huge beige foam head. Aroma is caramel and malt. Taste is bittersweet, lots of caramel. Aftertaste is long lasting sweet caramel. (Velp 201211)

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a clear, ruby brown colour with a magnificent, lacey tan head. Aroma is strong in dry fruits, caramel and a suggesitive roasted character. Taste is nice and heavy, lots of spicy, fruty sensations, perhaps some coffee? Finish is heavily bitter, superb.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber brown color with a longlasting off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy dark fruit and caramel aroma. Fruity malty spicy dark fruit caramel flavor with weak yeasty hints. Has a fruity malty dark fruit finish.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2012 aroma van moutig hop. robijnrood van kleur.
smaak van gerst, mout tarwe en een lichte zoetigheid.
vrij lichte tot zwakke body welke snel afvlakt.
afdonk licht bitter welke snel wegtrekt, verder flets en weinig bijzonder.

30 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Albert Heijn. Brown with a big tan head. Aroma of the typical La Trappe yeast with hops and  some roasted malts. After the first sip some coffee and chocolate is added to the palette. This beer is fairly bitter which continues in the aftertaste. Ofcourse a la Trappe beer is good but this bok is far above the rest of the bokbeer field.
On tap in TArendsnest. Poured reddish brown with a minimal white head. Aroma of rich malty fruit. Subdued flavour of spiced fruit and some bitterness with little aftertaste.

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy brown with cream tinted head. 
Aroma malts, bread, caramel, dark fruits, honey. 
Taste spicy bitter, a caramel, honey sweet. Little roast. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Awesome bockbeer, loads of taste and fantastic aroma.

Fine long lasting head with a brown hue. Hazy dark copper-brown color. Surprising smell, quite fresh and spicy, yet hints of honey and malts. Tastes of serious roast malts: bitter and sour, yet softened due to the added wheat. Fit for autumn indeed. Full body with moderate carbonation. Long and bitter yet not unpleasant finish.

ABV 7%
Untill now this is the best bock beer Ive tried this year. Those monks really know what theyre doing.
This is the only Trappist bock beer and the only bock beer that continues to ferment slightly in the bottle, at least according to their website.
Small bottle of 300 ml. Ingredients arewater, barley, wheat and oat malts, yeast and aromatic hops. Some yeast can be found in the bottle of course.
Pours a very dark ruby coloured beer, with a huge beige head of 3-4 fingers in height, thick and creamy, with excellent retention. Heavy lacing around the glass as the foam is going down, but never away. A thin layer of foam persists around the glass, while a big chunk of it lingers on the centre of the beers surface. Shake your glass a bit and another thin line of foam appears again, with almost the same sustainable retention.
A fantastic aroma on the nose from the hops. Light caramel , alcohol, some apricot, plums and other dark fruits.
Taste is great too. Sort of sweet at first but with a definitely bitter aftertaste. Caramel, coffee and dark bitter chocolate flavours.
Medium thickness on the body and average carbonation.Quite dry on the palate, with this dryness helping the bitter taste to stay longer in the outh.
As I wrote before, this is the best bock beer Ive tasted this far. I will surely get some more to drink during the cold days of autumn plus another couple to keep in my cellar.

Draft at Boterwaag.  Pours unclear dark brown with a tan head.  Aroma of burnt malts, caramel and a little raisin.  Flavour is unlike other bocks, moderate sweet but slightly over moderate bitter, getting away from the usual sweetness.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Poured into chalice and marvelled at the thick, silky head. Color is cola/coffe brown. Aroma is light, but taste is sharp and bracing. Very mellow roast grains come through, with very slight aftertaste.

O dont know if mt exemplar was with some variation, but the hop aromas were too mucho in evidence in contradiction surge theo bock style, quer the malta character os more important. Glauber its a great well balanced beer with médium to high body, beautiful red/brown colour, rate of roasted malt and caramell or burned .
Large amber head that clings to the glass. Prominent floral hoptones in the flavour, roasted malt lead to a light fuzzy finish

Belga Sörök Háza, Budapest. Sötét vörösesbarna szín, közepes méretű gyorsan múló bézs hab. Már illata is igen édeskés: karamell, mazsola, alkohol és kevés gyógyfüves komló. Íze hasonló, különösen a karamell intenzív benne. Egy igen édes baksör, ami az alkohol és a szirupos test miatt még inkább annak tűnik. Szerintem eléggé túlértékelt darab, sokkal jobbat vártam előzetesen.

What a great beer! Smooth, roasted malts, toffee, caramel. Lots of flavours! Nice red colour. You should drink this beer together with game or dark roasted pork. Great combination! Best Trappist beer!

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2014 Bottle, 2011, black, dark colour with a medium foamy mokka coloured head, malty sweet caramel smell, medium carbonation, sweet light caramel in the mounth some coffee, bitter toffee after taste

Head: much beige colored foam. Color: ruby brown. Aroma: laurel, malt. Taste: laurel, bitter. Palate: bitter, lasting. Overall: nice.

tap at cafe rose red ... deep brown ... creamy tan head ... sweet woody toffee malt ... sweet dark sugers ... bitter front ... soft toffee ... something else there im not liking ... a little creme caramel ... no not me at all...

33 cl bottle.
Pours a hazy mahogany with a foamy and lasting beige head, which laces.
Tart, fruity nose.
Yeasty aroma with dried fruits, caramel, alcohol, bread(crust) and herbs. Syrupy mouthfeel.
Dry and warming, sweetbitter finish escorted by citrusses, alcohol and distintct spices, which leaves a long tart aftertaste behind. Very nice.

Bottle by 10-2014.  Sweet nose vaguely of malt, some toffee and light nuts under the faint fruit.  Amber-ruby body with lots of carbonation and a foaming tan head.  Theres also a Belgian yeast component.  Taste is sweet, sickly so with some dark bitterness and more yeast; some Maillard fun here but its closer to the plum-and-berry side, with caramel/toffee and earth.  Medium body, a touch boozy but not too bad.  Overall not very memorable.

Bottled	16/06/12.  A nut brown coloured beer with a big whitish head.  Sweet in a Belgian way rather than German bock.  lots of candy sugar.  Belgian type hopping.  A good depth of flavour.  Cakey.  Really nice.
Bottle from Bierzwerg. Dark amber brown colour with huge head. Roasted aroma and flavour. Really tasty stuff.

330ml bottle. Clear deep dark red glowing brown with huge firm frothy lacing tan head. Dark malty aroma, dark fruit, dark berries, liquorice, leather. Complex taste, strong dark malty, toasty, dark fruity, dry, herbal. Absolutely recommendable.

33cl bottle, pours dark caramel/mahogany. Fast rising beige head. Alcohol, sweet candy & biscuit in the nose. Bit phenolic harsh mouthfeel, a hint of smoked & roasted wood. Flavor predominantly sweet. Sticky to harsh aftertaste. Not my cup of tea.

Pours a dark caramel brown. Smells of roasted malt and caramel. Tastes of roasted malt, caramel, and molasses with a bitter background. Finish is a balance between bitter and brown sugar. Pretty good.

Bottle - 330ml. Hazy dark brown body with an average off-white foamy head. Well balanced malty/hoppy aroma with brown sugar and fruity hints. Taste carries vineous, fruity notes and ends with a moderately warming bittersweet finish. Decent Bockbier.

Pours a thick white medium dense head.
Very dark amber.
Aroma is mostly dark chocolate, roasted coffee .. still a bit thin.
Medium sweet, medium bodied, alot of hops along with a thin malt,,  rather thin texture, lively carb, finished way too fast for this type of Ale.
I was expecting more .. as I was with the rest of the La Trappe line ... The only La Trape that has really caught me was an old Quatruppel, think it was 4-5 years in the bottle.
Not too bad overall, value is 6/10.

33 cl bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Originally rated on 20100715.
Pours red-brown color with medium off-white head. Aroma of sweet caramel, toffee, malts, ripe fruits and some sugary notes. Flavor of sweet caramel malts, sugar candy, toffee and mild spice notes.
6335
Pours dark brown with a high head. Aroma licorice, brown sugar. Some belgian hops. Medium palate. Not Bad.

Bottle courtesy of Ekstedt shared @ Ekstedts bock-tasting. Ours mahogany brown with a creamy off-white head that leaves lots of trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet with bread, ammonium chloride, prunes, raisins, dates, yeasty esters and alcohol. Taste is sweet with dark bread, caraway, cloves, phenols, esters and alcohol. Mouthfeel is round and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet, slightly bitter, malty and tiny metallic with bread and cloves.

Bottle shared thx to Ekstedt cons 2013-03-25
Ar: watery, caramel, dust
Ap: mahogny, high creme beige head lovely lacings
F: watery, caramel, dry, nutty, peppery,

Ruby/brown/red with little caramel/yello color, a bit mysterious.  Nice sweet abbey with fresh malt smell. Heavy bitter, strong low taste. A bit more heavier as to be expected from a bock-beer that has a mild smell and looks warm. After a few sips found some flavours of melted plastics which is not nice.
Pours mahogany with beige head, which dissipates fairly quickly. Sweet aroma; malt, caramel, raisins. Flavour has malt, walnutty bitterness and a bit of acidic bite.

Bottle @ home. Aroma is red fruit, caramel, touch of spice.
Flavour is medium caramel and malt sweetness, touch of bitterness, some spice. Decent, not too sweet bock.

330 ml. bottle.  Pours a dark reddish brown with a nice biege head.  Aroma of malt, caramel, yeast, and fruit.  Taste is yeast, caramel malt, dark fruit, and a bit of chocolate.  Nice and rich.  Slight bitter aftertaste.  Very good.

Currently drinking while typing. Once poured you have a great beer on front of you, great aromas of caramel, malt, toast and subtle booze. The look of it is also spotless, a full almost beige bubbly but creamy head sat on a beautiful mahogany depth in which light nicely but gently permeates. The taste is full, complex and clever. Starts with gentle hops and nice caramelled malts, also toasty and nutty, slows down into a nice burnt, smoky malt flavour with a lovely bitterness which surprises you. A nice but subtle hop note stays in the mouth in the long run. Great feel in the mouth, not thick or heavy but feels full and big, great carbonation that contains well in the mouth and also the foaminess that tickles the top lip. Exceptional beer, I think I will be missing it when the stock runs out until next autumn. Recommended!

chocolate, roasty, bread, spruce, resin, herbs, basement aromas, cooked vegetables, leather, smoke, rotten eggs, ginger, brown, hazy, frothy, brown foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium body, slick feel, flat, long finish, bitter,
Pours a dark brown with a full head. Aroma is full of caramel malty sweetness, yet it is balanced and not overly sweet with a nice kick of bitterness at the end. Excellent bock!
The caramel and brown sugar flavors accentuate the sweet character of this bock bier.  The trappist character remains, however, with a bit of a dark fruit flavor.  Dark brown, nice head.

fles 33 cl
Kleur: Diep donker rood met een lichtbruine brede schuimkraag.
Geur: Kruidig en zoet.
Smaak: Licht zoet, maar ook bitter. Lekker nasmaak van gebrand mout.
Redelijk veel koolzuur

Pours a dark brown body, with a big tan head. Aroma: Mostly malty. Taste: I can taste toffee and caramel which give it a sweet taste. Its also malty. And it has a roasty medium finish, not too long....

Bottle, 33cl.
Pours a dark brown, with an impressive offwhite head.
Smells of bready yeast and malt, with actually a lot of metallic scent (oxidation, Im guessing).
Tastes a mild sweetness, with an even milder bitter follow. Some dried red fruit, with a hint of brown sugar and some spice. Plenty of metal in the taste too, but it only popped up after my first impressions -- this bottle was very likely unintentionally aged for way too long before I even got it.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Texture is pretty creamy.
Ill have to find a newer example for next time: this one hints at something that could be quite impressive.

Dark clear ruby brown with a thick creamy tan head that diminishes quickly leaving a good lace. Typical plummy bock aromas of munich malts, sundried raisins and plum jam. Full bodied, well balanced, all on the munich malts and finishing on a chocolate note. Nice bock.

deep brown almost black pour with a light khaki head.  nose is sweet malts, dried fruits, rich, and sticky malts.  excellent on the palate, caramel, chewy malts, sweet fruits, more caramel, and a light roast finish.
Bottle. Dark amber with big tan head. Aroma is malt, caramel and fruit. Flavour is malt, yeast, caramel, medium sweet, hops, little nutty, little toffee and a little bitter.

poured into my founders brewery snifter.quarter inch of tan head that dissipated rather quickly.color is burgundy and is opaque.smell is a first musty and then comes across as a little sweet.wonderful mouthfeel to this lightly carbonated beer.tasting raisins and dates with brown sugar.first one of these for me and it wont be my last.very pleasant!
Clear dark amber with a big beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and nutty. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 271211
Bottle. Huge creamy head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are anise, caramel, fruits, malt and hops.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2013 33cl bottle. Dark red with small tanned head. 
NOSE : Dried fruits and cherries. Caramel malts. Makes me think of a Coca-cola a bit. Strong toffee and chocolate tart.  
SIP : Decent carbonation with oily texture. The body is medium. Sweet and oily in mouth. It reveals more sweet but with a burned and fruity background. Ending is A bit acidic and bitter. Mud and roots like aftertaste. Sweet notes are full of toffee and burned caramel. It becomes more like milk chocolate after a while. Burned flavors reveals flavors comparable to a chocolate tart. Some vanilla there too. Acidity is comparable to the aftertaste of coffee and smoked plums. Bitterness on the other hand is just a hint like coffee but mostly covered by the taste of when I bite through a citrus seed. 
OVERALL : complex and tasty. Amazing beer. perfect winter beer.

From Bottle into a mug,
Dark/haze color with not so much of a foam.
HUGE aromas of caramel, alcohol and liqueur.
Taste the same, with some dark fruits accompanying the caramel.
A very pleasant beer.
Mi è garbata davvero questa bock teutonica, in versione orange. Bellissimo laspetto, anche al naso è molto invitante. In bocca equilibrata, pulita e gustosa.

(33 cl)  Une petite tête mousseuse repose sur un liquide brun et opaque.  Une dentelle saccroche avec délicatesse.  Au nez, des effluves de caramel écossais côtoient des parfums de raisins et de prunes.  Les saveurs sont bien douces, maltées et rôties avec une petite touche chocolatée.  En bouche, le liquide est de belle corpulence avec un pétillement relevé et une texture crémeuse.  La finale est une combinaison de notes amères et de flaveurs dalcool.

Bottle: Poured a clear burgundy color ale with large off-white foamy head with good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of light residual sugar with some caramelized malt. Taste is a good mix between some caramelized malt with light toffee notes with some residual sugar. Boyd is about average but has a nice creamy texture with good carbonation. Easy drinking with nice level of complexity for style.

Bouteille de 330ml. Bière brune avec une couche épaisse de mousse brune-beige. Le nez est très sucré avec des notes de mélasse et de poire (jen rouve partout cest temps-ci). La bouche est chaude, ronde, sucrée, le malt domine malgré une certaine amertume en fin de bouche et un piquant sur la langue.

Bottle from a southern season. Pours dark ruby with an inch of khaki foam. Theres a bit ofmaltiness on the nose. Mouthfeel is dense with a hint of sweet molasses on the tongue. Finishes with some linger. That was different.

33 cl bottle. Pours a dark red-brown color. Firm off white, sticky head. Aromas of caramle malt, oats, a hint of acidity. Flavor is well balanced sweet and bitter (zoals het een goede bok betaamt). Medium body. Finishes malty sweet, roasted, slightly bitter. One of my favorite Dutch bocks at the moment.
Uit de fles. Ruikt vrij bitter,  begint licht zoetig in de mond maar dat gaat te snel naar bitter toe . De nasmaak is ook bitter. Niet mijn bier .
Dark brown with a nice big head that stays pretty long. A lot of malt in the nose and in the taste. A good bockbier.

Darker bown, with a reddish shine in it. A good sized, pretty nice holding and good sticky to the glass head. A bit harder to smell, a bit earthy-spiced, not bad at all, just a bit to hard to get it. Nutty and yeasty, some red fruits, 
bread, good spiced, with a nice caramel-sweet hint. Good balance between sweet and bitter, with a nice finish that tastes familiar, but cant tell what it is... A bit woody-earthy. Decent. But seems a bit outbalanced with the yeast.
Heerlijke textuur en bitterheid, pure chocolade, blijft lang hangen, maar geur doet iets minder aan. Prachtige licht bruine schuimlaag.

330ml bottle, dark ruby-mahogany color, with a tan colored head, nice yeasty, fruitcake, spicy, dried raisin, fig, date esters in the nose, with some biscuity, caramelized, toasted malty accents, and with some chocolatey, toffee, brown sugar, cookie dough, english pudding accents, within some graham cracker, french toast aromas follow through on a medium-bodied palate with a good yeasty, fruity, biscuity, toasty, caramelized, bready malt, fruitcake, chocolatey character with some dark bitter chocolate, cookie dough, toffeeish, light dark coffee flavours, with some brown sugar, molasses sweetness backbone, leading towards a warming fruity, chocolatey maltiness finish.
Pours a nice brown color with a slight foam head. One of the best Dunkler Bocks around and one of the best products from La Trappe. Rich and full taste. Slightly bitter, slightly roasted.

330ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Deep amber with a medium foamy and creamy head. Minimal lacing, long head retention.

Aroma : Belgian yeast, a bit nutty. Lots of caramel with red fruits. Nice spices. Light banana bread notes.

Taste : Belgian yeast with light banana bread. Spices and red fruits. Nice caramel especially on the finish. Light bitterness. More yeast on the finish.

Overall : Finish well balanced between sweetness and bitterness. Nice long finish. Nice caramel and yeast flavours. The Belgian influence on this bockbier is impossible to miss. Quite enjoyable and quite drinkable.

Bottle - thanks to Fred82. Brown with a nice biege creamy head. What a great aroma - fruit and malts mixed with yeast, butterscotch, some coffee and caramel but not too sweet - reminds me of a well aged St Bernardus although sweeter. Good carbonation and body, slightly bitter, bit of sourness in there towards the end as it becomes dry. An interesting combination of flavours but not what I was expecting, especially based on the aroma.
Tap at Cafe de Punt, Noordwijk: Dark brown coloured brew with an well balanced bitter taste with some hints of sweetness.

33 cl bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Clear ruby-mahogany with a large, fluffy light tan head.
  
Aroma:  Strong, almost pungent fruity malts, maybe a touch vegetal or something?, caramel and brown sugar, the vegetal note is kinda like boiled brassica (cauliflower, cabbage, broccoli), dark dried fruits, sweet smelling, an interesting mix of really rich malts and that odd badness.
  
Palate:  Medium body, somewhat loose effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Some bright fruitiness, plenty of caramel, brown sugar and molasses, thankfully almost no vegetal note, quite sweet, some alcohol comes through, a touch spicy, quite nice; sweet with minimal bitterness and a warming alcohol and sticky sweet malt finish.

Decent.

roasty, coffee, malty aroma, very dark with almost no head, roasty and sweet tastes with honey notes, sweet palate thats a bit acrid.  Pretty good beer, overall, though there are better examples of the style

75cl traded bottle a little less than a year old. The aroma and flavors are sweet at first, the middle is seriously watered down and then it finishes with some light bitterness. Its not bad, just thin.

Een aangename verrassing! Roodbruin, wat caramelkleurig bier met lichtbruine kraag. Geur is zoet, warm, kruidig en ietwat houtig. Smaak caramel, mout, rood fruit, kruiden. Goede verhouding zoet en bitter en de juiste hoeveelheid koolzuur. Mijn favoriete bokbier tot nu toe.

On tap at one pub in Maastricht. Dark brown color with huge beige head. Aroma of , coffee, roasted malt, caramel. Taste, nice bitter with coffee, dark chocolate notes, orange hints. Nice long bitter finish. Excellent.

Dark amber brown colour, tan head. Aroma of malts, caramel, raisins, fudge, dried fruits. Somewhat alcoholic in the nose. Flavour is sweet malty with a coarse roasty bitterness coming through. Somewhat sticky mouthfeel. Lingering taste, in the finish the residual sweetness manages to find balance with the roasty bitterness, sort of like cocoa. 
 (From 30cL bottle)

Mahogony brown, clear body with small head but lots of lacing. Toast, raisin, butterscotch and cheese. Quite a nice aroma, definitely not too sweet. Taste is good as well, light sweet flowing into light bitterness. Very end has a clear dry, cocoa-like feeling. Taste lingers... nice! Carbonation is fine. Maybe not terribly complex but tasty and very well brewed. Was very skeptical of a trappist bok but they earned a good rating. (33cl bottle, 1,75 EUR)

Pours dark amber with a medium head. Aroma is mostly malts. Flavor is deep with roasted malts and hops. Very good.

750ml Bottle with cork. Cork pops of, releasing damp and giving off a huge aroma off spices and ripe fruits. Nice and sweet malty aroma, some yeast. Bit of alcohol also. Looks are appealing, ruby red, brownish colour with creamy tanned head. Flavour is full, well balanced. Deep hazy ruby colour with a decent off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is of strawberries, spruce, toffee. Reasonably thin on the palate but well balanced with a slight bitter aftertaste. Taste is figs, lightly roasted malt, red currants.

From the bottle at De Kelk in Brugge during last weeks trip to Belgium. Reviewed from notes.

Served in a La Trappe chalice.

Pours a moderate brown color with a huge off-white head and loads of lacing on the way down. Persistent head and a cap throughout.
